title: A Locksmith Tricked People with High Bills
summary: A locksmith was secretly filmed by the BBC trying to charge much more money than promised. Many people complained about a company called 24/7 Locksmiths UK. One couple, Maureen and Eric, who are 85 years old, got locked out of their home. They called the locksmith, who said it would cost about £40 to help them. But after the work was done, the locksmith gave them a bill for over £2,800. The locksmith also did a bad job, so the couple had to pay another £2,244 to fix the door properly. The company did not answer the BBC's questions and closed its website. This is called a bait-and-switch scam, where people are tricked with a low price first, then charged a lot more later.

background_read: This article is about a problem where some locksmiths trick people by charging much more money than they first say. It happened to an older couple in London who got locked out of their home. The BBC investigated to show how these scams work and warn others to be careful when hiring services. Understanding this helps people learn to check prices and ask questions before agreeing to work.
Article_Structure: WHO: The BBC and a couple named Maureen and Eric, who are 85 years old.
WHAT: A locksmith tried to charge nearly 10 times more than the original price and did poor work.
WHERE: In London, at the couple's home.
WHY: To expose a bait-and-switch scam and warn people about dishonest locksmiths.

The BBC wanted to show how scams happen to help people avoid them.
